topic.title: Converting Old Templates with Custom HTML Page Layout Files to Version 21

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

keywords.indexterm: WebHelp Responsive Converting old publishing templates

body.p:
If you have a custom Publishing Template that was created in version 20.0 or 20.1 and it includes custom HTML page layout files, the following conversion procedure is required for the template to be compatible with version 21.0:
In the ProjectNavigator view, add the root directory of your custom Publishing Template (you can use a linked folderuse a linked folder and the easiest way to do this is to drag and drop the folder).If your template is stored as a ZIP archive, you first need to unzip it.
Expand your template directory, right-click the page-templates subfolder, and select Refactoring XML Refactoring .
In the XML Refactoring dialog box, scroll to the Publishing Template section and select Migrate HTML Page Layout Files to v21, then click Next.
The Scope should be left as Selected project resources.
You can use the Preview button to open a comparison panel where you can review all the changes that will be made by the refactoring operation before applying the changes.
Click Finish to perform the conversion.
